Setting Reference Directory Options

To perform this procedure, you must first select the project database or project you want to configure. The project database or project must also be associated with a configuration file.

To set reference directory options:

  1. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  2. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box.

  3. Select Reference Directory beneath Workfiles. The Reference Directory pane on the right appears. The values that display for each option are the settings that are currently defined in the configuration file associated with the project database or project.

  4. Enter the location of the reference directory in the Reference Directory field.

    You can enter a directory name and make it parallel to the archive directory structure by selecting the Keep a reference directory for each archive directory check box. For example, d:\refdir\project1\foo.c, d:\refdir\project2\bar.c is parallel to c:\db\archives\project1\foo.c-arc, c:\db\archives\project2\bar.c-arc.

  5. To maintain copies of tip revisions from the trunk only, select the Reference directory for trunk revisions only check box.

  6. To write-protect the files in the reference directory, select the Make reference files read only check box.

  7. Click OK if you are finished defining options, or click Apply to save the settings and continue to define other options.
